intro: Mormodes cucumerina, commonly known as the cucumber tree, is a tropical plant belonging to the Araliaceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 30 centimeters in diameter. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that develop into edible, cucumber-like fruits. Its botanical features include a woody stem, opposite leaf arrangement, and a climbing habit. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America, where it thrives in humid, tropical climates.
